result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Centrice Charmaine Weston

defendant.name: Weston, Centrice Charmaine

records.addlTxt: Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Brian Michael Borkowicz in court for Centrice Charmaine Weston. Case called at 11:02 a.m. Court orders capias and bail forfeiture.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Centrice Charmaine Weston not in court.  Attorney Brian Michael Borkowicz in court for Centrice Charmaine Weston.  Case called at 3:33 p.m.  Atty. Borkowicz states the defendant's bond was posted and then taken to Waukesha Co. and posted bond and then taken into custody for Milwaukee Co. and believe that is why she is not present and states there is an offer and request adjournment to discuss offer with defendant.
22R 014285 Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #15818 on 7-23-22
Per request of Atty. Borkowicz, motion to modify bond scheduled for 7-29-2022 at 3:30 p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Centrice Charmaine Weston
Current: 500 Rolfs Ave, Washington County Jail, West Bend, WI 53090 United States  (Effective: 07-22-2022)
Prior: 2668 N 45th St, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Centrice Charmaine Weston appears in custody and via video and by Attorney Brian Michael Borkowicz in person.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Not guilty plea entered by Court.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription, not possess any drug paraphernalia.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Centrice Charmaine Weston appeared by video, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Timothy Drewa appeared by video for Centrice Charmaine Weston.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Argument on bond. Not guilty plea entered by Court. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  Court sets $750 cash bond.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
Plea hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Plea hearing on July 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.
